summary: This document consists of multiple 30-minute inmate check sheets from the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated August 8, 2019. The sheets record scheduled observation rounds for inmates in locked-down status, requiring checks at least twice per hour. The document is significant as it provides a procedural record from the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held prior to his death.

events.title: Routine Inmate Observation Rounds
events.description: Staff at MCC New York's Special Housing Unit conducted scheduled 30-minute observation checks on inmates confined in continuous locked-down status, such as administrative detention or disciplinary segregation, as per standard procedure.

locations: MCC New York Special Housing Unit
keyFacts: The document is a set of prison log sheets from the MCC New York Special Housing Unit dated August 8, 2019.
It details a strict protocol requiring staff to observe inmates in locked-down status at least twice per hour on an irregular schedule, with checks no more than 40 minutes apart.
The sheets cover multiple tiers (ZA Tier-G, H, J, K; M-Tier; L-Tier; ZB) within the Special Housing Unit, indicating widespread use of this monitoring procedure.
Each sheet is reviewed and signed by a Morning Watch Lieutenant and a Captain, documenting compliance with observation requirements.
This type of procedural record is relevant to understanding the custodial environment at MCC New York around the time of Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and death.
